speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: SCENE II. The camp near Tamworth.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Enter RICHMOND, OXFORD, BLUNT, HERBERT, and others, with drum and colours

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Fellows in arms, and my most loving friends,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Bruised underneath the yoke of tyranny,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Thus far into the bowels of the land

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Have we march'd on without impediment;

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: And here receive we from our father Stanley

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Lines of fair comfort and encouragement.

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: The wretched, bloody, and usurping boar,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: That spoil'd your summer fields and fruitful vines,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Swills your warm blood like wash, and makes his trough

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: In your embowell'd bosoms, this foul swine

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Lies now even in the centre of this isle,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Near to the town of Leicester, as we learn

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: From Tamworth thither is but one day's march.

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: In God's name, cheerly on, courageous friends,

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: To reap the harvest of perpetual peace

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: By this one bloody trial of sharp war.

speaker: OXFORD
text_entry: Every man's conscience is a thousand swords,

speaker: OXFORD
text_entry: To fight against that bloody homicide.

speaker: HERBERT
text_entry: I doubt not but his friends will fly to us.

speaker: BLUNT
text_entry: He hath no friends but who are friends for fear.

speaker: BLUNT
text_entry: Which in his greatest need will shrink from him.

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: All for our vantage. Then, in God's name, march:

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: True hope is swift, and flies with swallow's wings:

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Kings it makes gods, and meaner creatures kings.

speaker: RICHMOND
text_entry: Exeunt
